name: Number of countries that are administering pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV)
descriptionShort: The number of countries that are administering pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) to either the entire country, regions of the country, adolescents or specific risk groups.

presentation.titlePublic: Number of countries administering pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV)

descriptionKey: Streptococcus pneumoniae is a bacterium that causes a number of common diseases including meningitis, septicaemia and pneumonia. It is most common in young children and the elderly.
Vaccines included in a countryâ€™s vaccination program are those that are provided and recommended through routine services.
They may or may not be mandatory and their coverage rates may vary widely.
When countries do not have a vaccine in their schedule, this does not necessarily mean that the vaccine is completely unavailable in those countries, as it may be available commercially.

origins.title: WHO Immunization Data - Vaccination Introductions
origins.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) provides data on the introduction of vaccines into vaccine schedules for countries around the world. The data is collected through the WHO/UNICEF Joint Reporting Form on Immunization.
origins.citationFull: Vaccine Introductions - WHO/UNICEF Joint Reporting Form on Immunization (2024), World Health Organization and  UNICEF.
